title: Connection Settings
content:
Configure network connection behavior and timeouts. Access via **Settings (⚙️) > Connection tab**.

## Active Projector Section

Shows details of the currently selected projector:
- Name, IP address, port, and brand
- **Edit** button - Modify projector configuration
- **Test** button - Run connection test

## Network Timeouts

Adjust how long the application waits for responses:

### Connection Timeout (3-30 seconds)
How long to wait when establishing initial connection.
- **Default:** 5 seconds
- **Increase if:** You have a slow network or distant projector
- **Recommended:** 5-10 seconds for most networks

### Command Timeout (5-60 seconds)
How long to wait for projector to respond to commands.
- **Default:** 10 seconds
- **Increase if:** Commands frequently timeout
- **Recommended:** 10-15 seconds for most projectors

### Status Update Interval (3-30 seconds)
How often to refresh projector status automatically.
- **Default:** 5 seconds
- **Lower value:** More frequent updates, more network traffic
- **Higher value:** Less network usage, slower status updates

## Reliability Options

### Enable Automatic Reconnection
When enabled, the app will automatically retry if the connection drops.
- **Recommended:** ✓ Enabled for stable operation

### Retry Attempts (1-10)
How many times to retry failed operations before giving up.
- **Default:** 3 attempts
- **Lower value:** Fail faster, less waiting
- **Higher value:** More resilient, but slower failure detection

## Managing Projectors

- **Add New Projector** - Configure additional projectors
- **Edit** - Modify existing projector settings (IP, password, etc.)
- **Remove** - Delete a projector configuration

> **Tip:** If you experience frequent timeouts, increase the Connection Timeout to 10-15 seconds and enable automatic reconnection.

> **Note:** Changes take effect immediately - no need to restart the application.
